intro: Stevia hirtiflora, commonly known as the hairy leaf stevia, is a perennial shrub native to South America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its lance-shaped, hairy leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is valued for its sweet-tasting leaves, which contain high concentrations of steviol glycosides, natural sweeteners. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in temperate climates. Due to its medicinal and culinary uses, it has gained interest in herbal and organic gardening practices.
